# Exploratory Data Analysis in R

## Install Necessary Libraries

```{r}
install.packages("ggplot2")
```

## Load Necessary libraries

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
```

## 1. Data Generation

```{r}
# Generate fake continuous data (e.g., "yield per hectare")
set.seed(123)  # For reproducibility
yield_data <- rnorm(100, mean = 50, sd = 10)  # 100 observations, mean=50, sd=10

# Display the first few rows of the data
head(yield_data)

```

## 2. Exploratory Data Analysis

```{r}
# Measures of Central Tendency
mean_yield <- mean(yield_data)
median_yield <- median(yield_data)
mode_yield <- as.numeric(names(sort(table(yield_data), decreasing = TRUE)[1]))

cat("Mean:", mean_yield, "\n")
cat("Median:", median_yield, "\n")
cat("Mode:", mode_yield, "\n")

# Measures of Dispersion
sd_yield <- sd(yield_data)  # Standard deviation
variance_yield <- var(yield_data)  # Variance
range_yield <- range(yield_data)  # Range (minimum and maximum)
amplitude_yield <- diff(range_yield)  # Absolute range

cat("Standard Deviation:", sd_yield, "\n")
cat("Variance:", variance_yield, "\n")
cat("Range:", amplitude_yield, "\n")

# Separating Measures
quartiles_yield <- quantile(yield_data, probs = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75))  # Quartiles
percentiles_yield <- quantile(yield_data, probs = seq(0.1, 1, by = 0.1))  # Deciles or Percentiles

cat("Quartiles:", quartiles_yield, "\n")
cat("Percentiles (Deciles):", percentiles_yield, "\n")
```

## 3. Graphical Analysis

```{r}
# Histogram
hist(yield_data, main = "Histogram of Yield per Hectare", 
     xlab = "Yield per Hectare", ylab = "Frequency", 
     col = "lightblue", border = "black")

# Boxplot
boxplot(yield_data, main = "Boxplot of Yield per Hectare", 
        ylab = "Yield per Hectare", col = "lightgreen")

# Bar chart for the frequency of rounded values
rounded_yield <- round(yield_data)
yield_table <- table(rounded_yield)
barplot(yield_table, main = "Bar Chart of Rounded Yield", 
        xlab = "Yield per Hectare (Rounded)", ylab = "Frequency", 
        col = "lightcoral", border = "black")

cat("Exploratory analysis completed.\n")
```
